labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on real-time cryptocurrency liquidation tracking from Binance, providing instant access to high-volatility market events. It enables AI agents to react quickly to liquidation data and offers tools for analyzing recent market trends. The primary use case revolves around monitoring and reacting to crypto market liquidations, which aligns with trading, market analysis, and automated responses to market movements.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected based on the server's core functionality of tracking and reacting to crypto liquidations, which falls under "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" due to its focus on market data and automated trading-related events. The secondary label of "Data Analysis & Processing" is chosen because the tool includes analysis tools for liquidation data. The server's unique focus on real-time liquidation events justifies the custom label "Real-Time Crypto Market Monitoring."

server_info_crawled.name: Crypto Liquidations
server_info_crawled.author: @kukapay/crypto-liquidations-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Stream real-time cryptocurrency liquidation events from Binance to enable AI agents to react instantly to high-volatility market movements. Retrieve and analyze recent liquidation data with easy-to-use tools and prompts for market trend insights. Stay updated with the latest market activity through a live, in-memory event feed.

tools.name: get_latest_liquidations
tools.description: Deploy Server Crypto Liquidations Claim Server @kukapay/crypto-liquidations-mcp Try in Playground get_latest_liquidations

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kukapay/crypto-liquidations-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
